spell.name: Acid Splash
entries: You create an acidic bubble and hurl it at a point within range, where it explodes in a 5-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that sphere must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} Acid damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Blade Ward

time.condition: which you take in response to a visible creature targeting you with a melee attack

entries: You trace a sigil of warding, imposing disadvantage on the creature’s attack roll against you.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Chill Touch
entries: You channel the chill of the grave toward one creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d10} Necrotic damage, and it can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 3d10}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Friends

components.m: a small amount of makeup applied to the face as this spell is cast

entries: You magically emanate a sense of friendship toward one visible creature within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed} condition for the duration. The target succeeds automatically if it isn’t a Humanoid, if you’re fighting it, or if you have cast this spell on it within the past 24 hours.
The spell ends early if the target takes damage or if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or force anyone to make a saving throw.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Poison Spray
entries: You launch a mist of toxic energy at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} Poison damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d12}), 11th level ({@damage 3d12}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d12}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Produce Flame
entries: A flickering flame appears in your hand and remains there for the duration. While there, the flame emits no heat and ignites nothing, and it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as a Bonus Action or if you cast it again.
Until the spell ends, you can take a action to hurl fire at a creature or an object within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Shillelagh

components.m: mistletoe, a shamrock leaf, and a club or quarterstaff

entries: A Club or Quarterstaff you are holding is imbued with nature’s power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon’s damage die becomes a {@dice d8}. If the attack deals damage, it can be Force damage or the weapon’s normal damage type (your choice).
The spell ends early if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.
The weapon’s damage die changes when you reach levels 5 ({@damage d10}), 11 ({@damage d12}), and 17 ({@damage 2d6}).

spell.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} lightning damage, and it can’t make Opportunity Attacks until the start of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Spare the Dying
entries: Choose a creature within range that has 0 Hit Points yet is alive. The creature becomes Stable.
The spell’s range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

spell.name: True Strike

components.m: a weapon with which you have proficiency

entries: Guided by a flash of magical insight, you make one attack with the weapon used in the spell’s casting. The attack uses your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If the attack deals damage, it can be Radiant damage or the weapon’s normal damage type (your choice).

Whether you choose to deal Radiant damage or the weapon’s normal damage type, the attack deals extra Radiant damage when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 1d6}), 11 ({@damage 2d6}), and 17 ({@damage 3d6}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Starry Wisp
entries: You launch a mote of light at one creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage, and until the end of your next turn, it emits Dim Light in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the {@condition Invisible} condition.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d8}), 11 ({@damage 3d8}), and 17 ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Ionizing Wind
entries: A blast of electrified wind erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 40-foot cone must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} lightning damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Plane Shift

m.text: a forked, metal rod worth at least 250 gp, attuned to a particular plane of existence

entries: You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination. If you are trying to reach the City of Brass, for example, you might arrive in its Street of Steel, before its Gate of Ashes, or looking at the city from across the Sea of Fire, at the DM's discretion.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

You can use this spell to banish an unwilling creature to another plane. Choose a creature within your reach and make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If the creature fails this save, it is transported to a random location on the plane of existence you specify. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence.

spell.name: Power Word Kill
entries: You utter a word of power that can compel one creature you can see within range to perish. The creature you chose takes {@damage 12d12} psychic damage. If this damage leaves it with 0 hit points, it dies.

spell.name: Healing Word
entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 2d4|1-9|1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mass Healing Word
entries: As you call out words of restoration, up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 2d4|3-9|1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cure Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mass Cure Wounds
entries: A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to {@dice 4d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by {@scaledice 4d8|5-9|1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Power Word Fortify
entries: You speak a word of power that fortifies up to six creatures you can see within range. The spell bestows 120 Temporary Hit Points, which are divided equally among the spell’s recipients.

spell.name: Night Sky
entries: With a wave of your hand, you force the sky above you to clear and become night, in a radius of 1 mile. Within the spell's area, spells that can be cast only at night (such as create undead) can be cast regardless of time of day.
When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to choose an effect, selecting the same effect or a different one.

entries.name: Dreamland
entries: The terrain within the spell's area shapes to your desires. The tactile characteristics of the terrain are unchanged, so creatures entering the area are likely to see through the illusion. If the difference isn't obvious by touch, a creature carefully examining the illusion can attempt an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to disbelieve it. A creature who discerns the illusion for what it is, sees it as a vague image superimposed on the terrain. You can end this effect as an action on your turn.

entries.name: Grim
entries: You imbue false life into a corpse you can see within the spell's area. It rises as a {@creature skeleton} if you choose a pile of bones, or a {@creature zombie} if you choose a fleshy corpse. On each of your turns, you can use an action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within the spell's area (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. The creature reverts to a corpse or pile of bones when the spell ends.

entries.name: Shooting Star
entries: A star streaks across the sky. One creature of your choice who can see the star gains 25 temporary hit points. While the creature has these hit points, it immune to {@condition frightened|PHB|fear}.

entries.name: Slumber
entries: You inflict drowsiness on a creature of your choice within the spell's area. If the target has less than 50 hit points, it falls {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, it takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake.

entries.name: Star Storm
entries: Ten stars fall from the sky. Each star hits a creature of your choice within the spell's area. Each star deals {@damage 1d4 + 1} force damage to its target (roll damage for each star separately). The stars all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several. Each time you use this effect, the sky grows darker. After the 10th use, the sky above becomes entirely dark, and you can no longer use this effect.

spell.name: Starcrossed Binding

m.text: two stone rings made from the same meteorite and a diamond worth at least 3000 gp

entries: You adorn two willing creatures within range, bonding them together across time and space. As long as the two creatures remain on the same plane of existence, each creature gains a +1 bonus to its AC and saving throws, and is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition. Additionally each target knows the direction and distance to the other, and if one of them travels or is transported to a different plane, the other knows to which one they went.

The spell ends if one of the creatures is dead. It immediately comes back into effect if the dead creature(s) are brought back to life. A creature can only benefit from this spell once in its lifetime.
This spell can only be dispelled by a {@spell wish} spell.

spell.name: Twinkle
entries: You create or manipulate lights you can see within range and that fit within a 5-foot cube:

items: You create a small burst of light, providing bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet until the start of your next turn.
You cause a nonmagical light to dim until the start of your next turn. An object that usually casts dim light no longer casts light, and an object that casts bright light now casts dim light.
You change the color of a light for 1 minute.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three non-instantaneous effects created by it active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Vacuum
entries: You draw all the air out of a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 8d6} bludgeoning damage and begins suffocating. On a successful one, it takes half as much damage and does not begin suffocating.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Mind Thrust
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}
You batter a creature within range with a torrent of psionic power. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On hit, the target takes {@dice 1d12} magical bludgeoning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Psionic Strike
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}

As part of an unarmed strike, you manifest a blade of psionic energy in your hand. On hit, the target takes psychic damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike. Your hand immediately reverts to its normal appearance at the end of the attack.
The damage die of this spell increases when you reach 5th level ({@dice 1d8}), 11th level ({@dice 1d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 1d12}).

spell.name: Id Insinuation
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}
You unleash conflicting desires within one creature you can see within range, impairing its ability to make decisions. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated}.

At the end of each of its turns, and each time it takes damage, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. It takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Tower of Iron Will

time.condition: when you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw

entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}

You protect your mind with a mantra of mundane, repetitive thoughts in order to better resist mental assault. Until the beginning of your next turn, you have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and you gain resistance to psychic damage.

spell.name: Cerebral Blast
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}

Your mind unleashes a mental thrust of overwhelming force in a 30-foot cone. Each creature within the area of this spell must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} magical bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet directly away from you, and falls {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and remains in place.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the magical bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Frawlstal's Fetid Fumes

components.m: a handful of beans, consumed by the caster

entries: A powerful, nigh invisible, stink cloud erupts silently in an area of your choosing. You choose to make the wall up to 45 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick or a solid circle that has a 25-foot diameter.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 7d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of it's next turn. It takes half as much on a successful save and is not {@condition poisoned}.

The first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 7d8} poison damage on a failed save and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of it's next turn, or half as much damage on a successful one, and is not {@condition poisoned}. If a flame is created in or enters the area of the cloud, it ignites, dealing an additional {@damage 3d8} fire damage to everyone in it's range, and the wall disappears. Leveled spells that generate wind effects also end the effects of this spell.

spell.name: Ego Scourge
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}

You strike at the mind of a creature you can see within range, attacking its very sense of self. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and it cannot cast spells. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw.
On a successful save, this effect ends on the target.

spell.name: Psychic Crush
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}

You exert the full force of your will on a creature. The target must make a Strength saving taking {@damage 5d8} force damage on a failure, and half as much on a success. At the end of each of its turns, it must repeat the saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d8} force damage on a failed save, and on a success, the spell ends.
If this spell reduces a creature to 0 hit points they are crushed into a ball the size of your fist.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, the initial force damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Psionic Oppression
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of psionics, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of the aberrant mind, through the wizardly study of psionics, or by making a warlock pact with a Great Old One.}

You psionically overwhelm the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 12d6} psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.
The {@condition stunned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Amanuensis
entries: Choose any non-magical writing you can see within range. That writing is magically copied onto a sheet of blank paper you are holding. This spell copies 250 words per minute and creates a perfect duplicate of the original. It does not translate the text or make it clearer.

Illustrations or magical writings (such as the text of a spellbook, a spell scroll, or a glyph of warding) cannot be copied by this spell. If the original text contains both normal writing and magical writing or illustrations (such as a letter with a glyph of warding or a drawing in one corner), only the normal text is copied.

You must provide blank paper, parchment, or another writing supplement for the spell to copy text onto. If a blank sheet would become filled with copied text as a result of this spell, you must cast the spell again with a new blank sheet of paper to continue copying.

spell.name: Amaterasu

components.m: a pinch of dust from an immolated vampire

entries: You exhale black flame toward a target creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target is engulfed in numbing black flames and becomes {@condition poisoned}. The target must make a successful Constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns for the duration, or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} for each failure. If the target makes three successful Constitution saves, the fire vanishes as soon as it came, and the target is no longer poisoned.
On the target’s turn, anyone adjacent to it must make a successful Dexterity saving throw or be engulfed in Amaterasu's wreathing black flames.

Anyone killed by Amaterasu is disintegrated (as if by the {@italic disintegrate} spell). A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

When not applied to a creature, Amaterasu's flames are said to burn for seven days and seven nights, but the black flame will not spread as normal fire would, instead remaining still. Like an eternal light.

spell.name: Breath of Shadow
entries: You breathe forth a cloud of impenetrable shadow which exhales from your mouth and spreads itself around a point you can see within range. It then manifests into the shape of a cylinder with a radius of 10-feet and a height of 20-feet that is lightly obscured.
A creature which starts it turn or moves into the area for the first time on a turn must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage.
The body of a creature killed by this spell becomes withered beyond recognition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can cast this spell using a 5th level or higher spell slot. The necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Glacial Path
entries: You cause a pulse of frost energy to burst out from you in a line 15-feet wide and 30 feet long, covering the ground in the line in slick ice for the duration. Hostile creatures treat this ice as difficult terrain.
When you first cast the spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see. When those creatures move on the ice, they only need to expend 1 foot of movement for every 2 feet they move.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the length of the line creases by 30 feet and the width of the line increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Frost Lance
entries: You hurl a frigid lance forged from ice at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if its movement speed has been reduced or is 0. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 5d12} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3th.

spell.name: Desecrate Earth
entries: You invoke a foul curse upon the land, desecrating it beyond the Material realm and transforming it into your own personal territory. When you cast this spell, a 30-foot radius of ground within range withers and uproots itself, twisting and dancing to the tune of a mysterious shadow.
Undead creatures standing or flying above this ground have advantage on effects which turn undead. If a creature already has advantage on such effects, they instead gain immunity to them.

In addition, at the start of their turns, any undead on this ground gain {@dice 1d10} temporary hit points. Undead created through animate dead gain temporary hit points at the start of the caster's turn.

After you break concentration on this spell, the ground loses its magical effects. However, it remains forever tainted: bearing fewer plants, turning blackened and withered, and becoming detectable through a paladin's divine sense.

spell.name: Mass Repair Damage
entries: You transmute the structure of constructs to repair them out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six constructs in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to 3d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on other creatures.  This spell can be used to repair technological items, objects, and structures at a DM's discretion.
{@bold Special.} Half-constructs (such as Warforged, Starforged, and Nasods) can benefit from this spell despite not being full constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Memory of Ash
entries: You touch the corpse of a dead humanoid that is not an undead. Over the duration of this spell's casting time, you slowly reduce that creature to ash, as their body vacates to the pressures of your necromancy and scatters to the winds.
Upon completion, you learn one of the following things about the creature, which may or may not assist in your journey:
{@bold Eyes of Ash.} You receive a vision of the creature's death starting 10 seconds before its demise (from the creature's perspective).
{@bold Soul of Ash.} One important, yet simple thing about the creature of your choice. Examples of this may include what the creature loved the most, what they despised, and their worries.
{@bold Heart of Ash.} The goal the creature was trying to achieve prior to its death (if any).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, you learn one additional Ash for every level above 2nd. In addition, you can choose Eyes of Ash multiple times. When you do, you increase the length of the vision by 10 additional seconds.

spell.name: Miasma of Death
entries: Choose either a corpse or an undead creature under your control within range. The target explodes into a cloud of dense, purple, toxic gas. The explosion is as unsightly as it is uproarious, blistering the skin of nearby creatures and sending those who need to breathe into massive coughing fits.
Immediately upon this spell's casting, the target is reduced to an unrecognizable husk. If the target was an undead creature under your control, that undead is instantly killed.

Any creature within 10 feet of the explosion must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 3d6} poison or necrotic damage (your choice), or half as much on a successful save. If the creature failed the save, that creature is also poisoned until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every level above 2nd.

spell.name: Nightmare Sphere
entries: You erect a 5-foot diameter black sphere at an unoccupied point within range. The sphere is semi-solid (treated as difficult terrain) and provides half-cover when hid behind.

As a bonus action, you can move the sphere 20-feet in any direction within range. A creature who starts its turn within 10-feet of the sphere, or touches it for the first time in a turn, must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 2d6} psychic damage, and the sphere morphs to reflect one of their darkest fears.

A creature who is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is knocked unconscious, stabilized, and becomes immune to this spell for as long as they remain unconscious. In addition, that creature experiences horrible nightmares for the next {@dice 1d4} days.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Iron Fist
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You hold iron in the palm of a free hand used in the spell’s casting and make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d12} bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, the creature must also make a Constitution saving throw or fall prone.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Auric Lance
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You fling a golden needle at a target within range, which expands into a deadly spear. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target suffers {@damage 8d8} piercing damage and gleams with a golden aura, granting advantage on all attacks against them until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} per slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Quicksilver Lash
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You transform a few drops of quicksilver into a massive whip, striking out at your enemies. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. If the attack hits, the target takes {@damage 6d8} slashing damage, and a Large or smaller target must make a Strength saving throw. If they fail the saving throw, you can pull them toward you up to 30 feet and knock them {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Shard Rain
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You create a terrible storm of jagged metal, raining down in a 100-foot-high column with a 30-foot radius. Every creature within the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 9d8} piercing damage on a failure or half as much on a success. If a Large or smaller creature fails by 5 or more, they are pinned to the ground, becoming {@condition restrained}. They or any creature within 5 feet can use their action to pull the shard free, attempting a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC and freeing themselves on a success.

spell.name: Silver Wind
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You summon a hail of silver needles, flinging them in a direction of your choice. The needles form a line originating from you that is 5 feet wide and 60 feet long. All creatures within their path must make a Dexterity saving throw, suffering {@damage 6d8} piercing damage on a failure or half as much on a success. Shapechangers and other creatures susceptible to silver have disadvantage on this saving throw, and on a failure, cannot change their form until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Steelskin
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You touch a creature and transmute their skin into a fine layer of worked steel. Until the spell ends, the target's armor class can't be lower than 19, and they have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. At the start of each of the target's turns, they gain 10 temporary hit points.

spell.name: Whirling Daggers
entries: You fill a 5-foot-diameter sphere with whirling daggers in a space of your choice within range for the duration. A creature takes {@damage 4d4} slashing damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.
As an action, you can cause the daggers to point and shoot at a creature within 30 feet of the sphere. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, targets take {@damage 4d4} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shape Metal
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}
You rest your hand on a Tiny or Small metal object and alter its properties. You can manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: You alter its weight, reducing or increasing it by up to half.
You alter its appearance. You can make it look like any other metal, adjust how reflective it is, and make minor changes to its texture.
You alter its form, bending or stretching it up to half its length.
You enhance its malleability, granting advantage to attempts to craft or sculpt it while you maintain this effect.
If it is a blade, you sharpen or dull its edge, increasing or reducing its next damage roll by 1 point.
You can harden an object, increasing its hit points by your sorcerer or wizard level.

entries: After 1 minute, or as soon as you cast the spell again, the object returns to normal.

spell.name: Alter Metal
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You point at a nonmagical metal object within range and dramatically change its properties. The object must be Huge or smaller, and can't be worn or carried. You can manipulate it in any number of the following ways:

items: You can stretch or compact it. You can halve its size, double its size, or anything in between. Its weight does not change, nor does the actual quantity of metal.
You turn it into another metal of similar value.
You can reshape it into another object of similar size.
You can alter its strength, reducing its hit points to one-quarter or increasing them to four times the original.

spell.name: Keen Weapon
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}
You point at a metal weapon and magically enhance its sharpness or hardness. Until the spell ends, the target weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of its damage type on a hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell can target an additional weapon for each two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Magic Bullet
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism.}

As your bonus action, you touch one piece of metal and imbue it with magic to create a bullet that hovers around you. As a bonus action, you can also make a ranged spell attack with one magic bullet against a creature within 120 feet. On hit, the creature takes piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Whether the attack hits or misses, and if not destroyed, the magic bullet returns to hover around you.

The spell creates more than one bullet when you reach higher levels: two bullets at 5th level, three bullets at 11th level, and four bullets at 17th level. You can also direct all the bullets at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each bullet.

spell.name: Incandescent Blade

components.m: a nonmagical dagger or sword, which is consumed

entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You take hold of a small sword, and turn it into an enormous white-hot blade of glowing metal. The sword gives off dim light in a 20-foot radius, and an overwhelming heat that deals {@damage 2d6} fire damage to all other creatures starting their turns within 5 feet of you.

While wielding the sword, you can use your action to make a melee spell attack against one or two adjacent creatures within 10 feet, dealing {@damage 3d8} fire and {@damage 3d8} slashing damage on a hit. Alternately, you can use your action to attempt to impale one creature within 15 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take {@damage 6d8} fire and {@damage 6d8} piercing damage. If this reduces them below 30 hit points and they are not immune to fire damage, they are incinerated, dying instantly and turning to ash. After attempting to impale a creature in this way, the spell ends.

spell.name: Fount of Moonlight
entries: A cool light wreathes your body for the duration, emitting Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet.
Until the spell ends, you have resistance to Radiant damage, and your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage on a hit.

In addition, immediately after you take damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself, you can use your Reaction to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Blinded} condition until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hovering Weapon
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You touch a weapon and it hovers around you. The hovering weapon uses your spellcasting modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for its attack and damage rolls. If you are proficient with the weapon, you can add your proficiency bonus to its attack roll. You can use your hovering weapon to attack whenever you take the {@action Attack} action. It can benefit from any feats, fighting styles, or features you possess that would apply to the weapon normally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you gain an additional attack when you take the {@action Attack} action with the hovering weapon. You gain an additional attack for every two levels above 3rd, up to a maximum of four attacks if you cast this spell at the 7th level.

spell.name: Metallic Sphere
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

A 10-foot-radius sphere of metal surrounds and protects you, but you cannot see through it nor others see in. The Metallic Sphere has hit points equal to your maximum hit points at the time the spell is cast and shares your AC. Your sphere is immune to damage from attacks made by bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing from non magical weapons and can move in any unobstructed direction while you are inside, up to a distance equal to your movement speed. Two medium creatures can fit inside the metallic sphere or one large creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet and allows an additional medium creature inside the metallic sphere for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Wall of Metal

components.m: a small block of metal, which the spell consumes

entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

The block of metal expands into a magical metal wall 10-foot-by-50-foot. The wall is as thick and of the same type of metal as the block. The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. The wall of metal has an AC of 18 with 200 hit points and is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. The wall can’t occupy the same space as a creature. If the wall cuts through a creature’s space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), that creature can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall. The wall doesn’t need to be vertical or rest on any firm foundation. If you maintain your concentration on this spell for its whole duration, the wall becomes permanent and can’t be dispelled. Otherwise, the wall disappears when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the wall gains 5 feet in height and 10 feet in length for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Flashdaggers
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You summon a spray of knives, hurling them at a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d4} piercing damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 2d4} per slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Iron Garden
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

Iron spikes lance upwards from the ground in all directions around you, impaling creatures within 20 feet of you. Creatures in the target area must succeed a Dexterity saving throw, or take {@damage 6d8} piercing damage, and their movement speed drops to zero until the end of their next turn. On a success, they take half as much damage, and their movement speed is not reduced to zero.

Until the start of your next turn, when a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels. At the start of your next turn, the spikes rust away to dust.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a 5th level or higher spell slot, the initial damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each level spell slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Infernal Shackles

components.m: a link from a chain burned in a fire that killed at least one creature

entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

Chains of burning black iron spring from the ground and attempt bind a creature you can see within range. The target creature must make a Strength saving throw. On failure, it takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage and its movement speed is reduced to zero for the duration of the spell. On success, they take half as much damage and are not bound.

At the end of each of their turns, the target repeats its saving throw. On a success, the chains broken and the spell ends for that target. On a failure, it remains bound and takes an additional {@damage 2d6} fire damage as it is seared by the chains.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 3rd level spell slot or higher, you can target an additional creature for each spell slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Whirling Weapon
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

You throw a melee weapon used in the spell’s casting. The weapon whirls around in a 60-foot cone and any creatures of your choice in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or get hit by the weapon for {@damage 6d8} damage of the weapon's type, and become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition blinded}. The weapon when thrown in this manner counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Metal Wings
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

Your magic melts metal into a liquid that molds into a pair of metal wings on the back of a suit of armor. These wings are magic and can be used with all armor types. When the spell ends, the wings dematerialize. The wings grant a flying speed of 30 feet, the ability to hover in place, and gain one additional property depending on the type metal used in the spell’s casting:

items: {@b Iron.} As an action, the wings can be used as a melee weapon attack against creatures within 10 feet. On hit, the creature takes {@dice 3d6} + your spellcasting modifier in slashing damage.

{@b Steel.} As an action, the wings can shoot razor sharp feathers in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 5d4} piercing damage, or half damage on a successful save.
{@b Silver.} The wings also grant resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
{@b Gold.} The wings grant a swimming speed of 50 feet.
{@b Mithral.} Flying in or out of an enemy’s reach doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

{@b Adamantine.} The wings also grant advantage on Constitution saving throws and resistance to damage from attacks made by siege weapons and imbues the properties of adamantine armor as your wings defend you.
{@b Infernal Iron.} The wings also grant resistance to damage from cold and fire.

spell.name: Manipulate Projectile
entries: {@italic The following spell requires proficiency in harnessing the powers of magnetism, which can be gained through having an innate sorcerous origin of magnetism or through the wizardly study of metallurgy.}

When you see an attack from a ranged weapon shoot a projectile containing metal within 120 feet of you, you can attempt to manipulate the projectile using your reaction to contest the attack roll with your spell attack roll before it hits its target. If your spell attack roll is greater than the original attack roll, you stop the projectile in mid air, gain concentration, and the projectile comes under your control as a Magic Bullet. If the attack roll is greater and the projectile hits, the target takes half damage. If you do not wish to control it as if it was a Magic Bullet, you may simply drop the projectile and not gain concentration.

spell.name: On/Off
entries: This cantrip allows you to activate or deactivate any electronic device within range, as long as the device has a clearly defined on or off function that can be easily accessed from the outside of the device. Any device that requires a software-based shutdown sequence to activate or deactivate cannot be affected by on/off.

spell.name: Putrid Plague

m.text: a cup of blood, a parasite egg and herbs worth 150 gp, all of which the spell consumes

entries: You touch the corpse of a Large or smaller creature, birthing life to a myriad of parasites and maggots that immediately begin feasting on the corpse by collecting in the creature's chest cavity. If the corpse is disturbed at any point after this spell's casting, its chest blows open.
Any creature within 10-feet of the disturbed corpse must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 4d6} piercing damage and becomes infested with a parasite.

The parasite counts as a disease and deals {@dice 2d6} poison damage to its host at the end of every hour. It can be removed by another creature as part of a 30-minute long operation. In order to perform the procedure, the creature must have a cutting instrument and make a successful DC 12 + your spellcasting modifier Dexterity (Medicine) check. On a failed check, the creature takes {@dice 2d6} slashing damage, and the parasite is not removed.

If the host is killed by this parasite, it then begins to birth forth a myriad of parasites and maggots inside the host's body. One hour prior to the creature's death, it will start spreading the disease upon disturbing as if this spell was casted on it. Burning the corpse, disintegrating it, or killing the infected creature with radiant damage prevents this from occurring.

spell.name: Reconstruct
entries: Choose a construct that you can see within range. You greatly repair it, causing it to regain 60 hit points. This spell also grants the target the benefits of the {@spell haste} spell for 2 rounds. This effect does not stack with Haste, and does not impose the penalties of {@spell haste} when this effect expires. This spell has no effect on other creatures. This spell can be used to repair technological items, objects, and structures at a DM's discretion.
{@bold Special.} Half-constructs (such as Warforged, Starforged, and Nasods) can benefit from this spell despite not being full constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of healing increases by 10 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Repair Damage
entries: A construct you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on other creatures. This spell can be used to repair technological items, objects, and structures at a DM's discretion.
{@bold Special.} Half-constructs (such as Warforged, Starforged, and Nasods) can benefit from this spell despite not being full constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Scythe of the Reaper
entries: You form a scythe of necrotic energy in your hands, constructed from the lingering regrets and miasma in the air. You then swing it at a creature in range, cutting a line from this world to the next.
The creature you target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creatures takes {@dice 8d6} necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save.

A humanoid who is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell immediately dies, as its flesh it stripped from its bones and its skeleton rises to serve you. The skeleton rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn in initiative.
The skeleton becomes inanimate after one hour, or once it drops to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can cast this spell using a 4th level or higher spell slot. The necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Siphon Vitality
entries: Target a creature that you can see within range that is not a construct or undead. That creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage.
On a failed save, you can add a {@dice 1d4} to the next saving throw you make before the start of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Swarm of Decay
entries: You call forth a swarm of ravenous, decaying insects to spring to life at your fingertips. At your command, they fly over to a creature within range. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 1d6} poison damage, or half as much on a successful one.

On subsequent turns, you can direct the swarm to attack another creature within range, or move back to you as a bonus action. If you do not direct the swarm at the end of your turn, they instead attack the same creature without need of an action. If the swarm ever leaves your range, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every level above 1st.

spell.name: Encode Thoughts
entries: Putting a finger to your head, you pull a memory, an idea, or a message from your mind and transform it into a tangible string of glowing energy called a thought strand, which persists for the duration or until you cast this spell again. The thought strand appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you as a Tiny, weightless, semisolid object that can be held and carried like a ribbon. It is otherwise stationary.

If you cast this spell while concentrating on a spell or an ability that allows you to read or manipulate the thoughts of others (such as {@spell detect thoughts} or {@spell modify memory}), you can transform the thoughts or memories you read, rather than your own, into a thought strand.

Casting this spell while holding a thought strand allows you to instantly receive whatever memory, idea, or message the thought strand contains. (Casting detect thoughts on the strand has the same effect.)

spell.name: Dancing Decoy

m.text: a tiny clockwork puppet worth at least 50 gp

entries: You toss a clockwork puppet to an unoccupied space that you can see within range. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it, seeing the object for what it really is. To others, the decoy projects the illusion of a medium humanoid of your choice that performs a taunting dance or an intimidating gesture goading them to fight it. As a bonus action on your turn, you can mentally command the puppet to move up to 20 feet.

Creatures that start their turn within 10 feet of the puppet must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is compelled to move toward the decoy and make a melee weapon attack against it, believing it to be the primary threat. Attacks against the illusion harmlessly flow through the illusion and do not usually damage the puppet, though exceptions can occur. On a successful save, a creature realizes that the projected humanoid is an illusion and becomes immune to the effects of this spell for 24 hours. Creatures that are immune to the {@condition charmed} condition automatically succeed on this save. The effect on a creature also ends if it takes any damage.

spell.name: Conjunction of Air

components.m: an item originally from a plane of air, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of elemental air in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. For the duration of the spell, all creatures gain a flying speed of 30 feet while inside the cylinder. A creature that is still in flight when the spell ends floats safely to the ground, as if by the feather fall spell. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can cause one of the following effects:

items: The cylinder fills with magical silence. No sound can be created within or pass through the cylinder. Any creature or object entirely inside the cylinder is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Performing verbal components of spells is impossible within the cylinder. This silence lasts until the spell ends, you dispel it as a bonus action, or you fill the cylinder with magical amplification.

The cylinder fills with magical amplification. Creatures within the cylinder make saving throws against effects that deal thunder damage with disadvantage, and nonmagical objects and structures become vulnerable to thunder damage while inside. Spells that can normally only target creatures can also target nonmagical objects and structures within the cylinder. This amplification lasts until the spell ends, you dispel it as a bonus action, or until you fill the cylinder with magical silence.

You compress the air in the cylinder. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Conjunction of Chaos

components.m: an item originally from a plane of chaos, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of chaos and entropy in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. That area is under the following effects for the duration of the spell:

items: Whenever a spell originates in the cylinder, there is a 25 percent chance that a random effect from the Wild Magic Surge table replaces the spell’s intended effect, and a 25 percent chance that one occurs immediately after the spell is cast as well. The Wild Magic Surge table can be found in Chapter 3 of the Player’s Handbook, under the description of the Wild Magic Sorcerous Origin.
Each time a creature moves 5 feet within the cylinder, there is a 50 percent chance that it moves in a random direction instead of the intended one.

spell.name: Conjunction of Dawn

components.m: an item originally from a plane of light or rebirth, worth at least 10gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of light and rebirth in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. That area is under the following effects for the duration of the spell:

items: Creatures in the area have disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded} and effects that deal radiant damage. Celestials are immune to this effect.
Spells cast within the cylinder that restore hit points function as if they were cast at one level higher than the spell slot used.

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 7th level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can target a creature in the area with one of the following effects:
If the creature has died within the last 10 minutes, it is restored to life with 1 hit point.
You end one disease affecting the creature.
The creature’s {@condition exhaustion} level reduces by 1.
You end one of the following conditions affecting the creature: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, or {@condition petrified}.

spell.name: Conjunction of Earth

components.m: an item originally from a plane of earth, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of elemental earth in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can cause one of the following:

items: The surface of stone, dirt, and any other earthen area within the cylinder liquifies and becomes sticky, turning into difficult terrain. A creature that starts its turn on such a surface must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or become stuck to the surface and be {@condition grappled} until the start of its next turn. A creature {@condition grappled} in this way has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. When the spell ends, this grapple ends.

Stone, dirt, and other earthen surfaces within the area buck wildly. Each creature on such a surface must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and be moved 10 feet in a random horizontal direction within the cylinder. This spell has no effect on structures.

spell.name: Conjunction of Fey

components.m: an item originally from a plane of fey or dreams, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of fey and dreams in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. For the duration, all nonmagical plants and beasts in the area are given intelligence and movement, as if by an awaken spell. They lose this benefit when the spell ends or if they leave the cylinder. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can cause one of the following effects:

items: Each creature within the cylinder must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by or {@condition frightened} of you (your choice when you take the action) for the duration of the spell. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Fey automatically succeed on this saving throw.

Each creature within the cylinder must succeed a Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for the duration of the spell. Attempts to wake creatures sleeping in the cylinder automatically fail. A creature who is {@condition unconscious} can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to magical sleep for 24 hours. Fey are immune to this effect.

You summon a {@creature swarm of sprites|WMPS} in an unoccupied space of your choice within the cylinder. These sprites are hostile to all creatures in the area that are not Fey, and disappear when the spell ends or if they leave the cylinder.

spell.name: Conjunction of Flame

components.m: an item originally from a plane of fire, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of elemental fire in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. For the duration of the spell, all creatures within the area make saving throws against effects that deal fire damage with disadvantage. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can cause one of the following effects:

items: You magically conjure {@dice 1d4} {@creature magma mephit|MM}, {@creature smoke mephit|MM}, or {@creature steam mephit|MM} (your choice) in unoccupied spaces of your choice within the cylinder. They are hostile to all creatures that are not elementals and act on their own initiative count. These mephits lack the Summon Mephits action. A mephit summoned in this way disappears when the spell ends or if it leaves the cylinder.
You mentally command all mephits summoned by this spell to immediately die, triggering their Death Burst traits.

You ignite all flammable objects within the cylinder. Creatures are also at risk of catching on fire and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or else catch fire. A creature that is on fire or is wearing or holding something that is on fire takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage at the start of each of its turns, and can take this damage no more than once each turn. A creature can use its action to drop {@condition prone} and extinguish the flames on it. Flames ignited in this way go out when the spell ends or if they leave the cylinder.

spell.name: Conjunction of Mundanity

components.m: an item originally from the material plane, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with one of the many material planes in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. Whenever a spell that deals damage begins at, ends inside, passes through, or overlaps with the cylinder, you can use your reaction to attempt to neutralize the spell by making an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC for this check is equal to 10 + the level of the spell slot used to cast the spell (DC 10 for cantrips). If you succeed, the spell ends immediately and has no further effect. As an action on your turn, you can attempt to banish an otherworldly creature in the area. A creature of your choice within the cylinder must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or else be teleported to its native plane. Humanoids and creatures native to your current plane of existence automatically succeed on this saving throw.

spell.name: Conjunction of Shadow

components.m: an item originally from a plane of shadow or lethargy, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of shadow and lethargy in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. That area is under the following effects for the duration of the spell:

items: Creatures in the cylinder’s area are immune to the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions. If a creature is {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} when it is in the area of the spell, the effect causing that condition ends.
All saving throws made in the cylinder against effects that deal necrotic damage are made with advantage or disadvantage (your choice when you cast the spell).

When a humanoid creature dies in the cylinder, it immediately becomes a zombie under your mental control. All zombies created in this manner share your initiative count, but act immediately after you. These zombies return to mundane corpses when the spell ends or if they leave the cylinder. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can cause one of the following effects:

The cylinder fills with magical darkness until you dispel it as a bonus action or until the spell ends. If this effect overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 5th level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Each creature in the cylinder must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be stricken with extreme lethargy. A creature that fails this saving throw wastes its next turn doing nothing. Undead and constructs are immune to this effect.

spell.name: Conjunction of Natural

components.m: an item originally from a plane of flora and fauna, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of flora and fauna in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. That area is under the following effects for the duration of the spell:

items: All creatures in the area are under the effects of a speak with animals spell and can communicate with plants, as if by the speak with plants spell.
The effects of the awaken spell are suppressed within the cylinder.
Each beast or plant creature gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns while it is within the cylinder.

All nonmagical terrain in the cylinder either becomes difficult terrain or normal terrain for the duration of the spell (your choice when you cast the spell). The ground may turn rough and rocky, dense foliage may temporarily thin out, or some other natural effect of your choosing occurs.

spell.name: Conjunction of Nexus

components.m: an item originally from a plane of connection and travel, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of connection and travel in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered at a point within range. The area is under the following effects for the duration of the spell:

items: Each creature in the cylinder can use its bonus action to teleport to an unoccupied space that it can see within the cylinder.
All creatures within the area have disadvantage on saving throws against being teleported against their will (such as by the banishment or plane shift spells).

spell.name: Conjunction of the Other Side

components.m: an item originally from a plane of judgment or afterlife, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of judgment and afterlife in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. That area is under the following effects for the duration of the spell:

items: Each corpse in the area is under the effects of a speak with dead spell for the duration, without a limit of the number of questions it can be asked.
All creatures in the area make death saving throws with either advantage or disadvantage (your choice when you cast the spell).

When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can summon spirits from beyond the grave. A random incorporeal undead appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within the area. It is indifferent to all other creatures, but will defend itself if attacked. The creatures disappear if they leave the cylinder or when the spell ends. To determine what type of undead appears, roll {@dice 1d12} and consult the following table.

entries: Other Side Summons
{@dice 1d12} Undead Creature
1-3 {@creature shadow|MM}
4-6 {@creature specter|MM}
7-8 {@creature poltergeist|MM}
9-10 {@creature Will-o'-Wisp|MM}
11 {@creature banshee|MM}
12 {@creature ghost|MM}

spell.name: Conjunction of Water

components.m: an item originally from a plane of water, worth at least 10 gp

entries: You begin to merge your current plane of existence with a plane of elemental water in a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on a point that you can see within range. It is perpetually raining within this cylinder, and all nonmagical fires are extinguished. A creature that is wet within this cylinder has disadvantage on saving throws against cold or lightning damage. This water disappears when the spell ends or if it leaves the cylinder. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can cause one of the following effects:

items: You magically conjure {@dice 1d4} {@creature ice mephit|MM}, {@creature mud mephit|MM}, or {@creature steam mephit|MM} (your choice) in unoccupied spaces of your choice within the cylinder. They are hostile to all creatures that are not elementals and act on their own initiative count. These mephits lack the Summon Mephits action. A mephit summoned in this way disappears when the spell ends or if it leaves the cylinder.
You mentally command all mephits summoned by this spell to immediately die, triggering their Death Burst traits.
You fill the cylinder with magical fog, as if by the fog cloud spell. This fog dissipates when the spell ends or when you dispel it as a bonus action, and cannot be blown away by a strong wind.

You cause the water on all surfaces in the cylinder to freeze. These surfaces count as difficult terrain, and any creature that makes a Strength (Athletics) check, Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, or that takes the Dash action on an icy surface must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the creature falls {@condition prone} immediately after completing the check or action and takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, nothing happens.

spell.name: Conjure Greater Animals
entries: You summon a fey spirit that takes the form of a beast or swarm of beasts and appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. You choose the type of beast or swarm of beasts, which must be of challenge rating rating 5 or lower, such as a giant shark or swarm of poisonous snakes. The beast is also considered fey, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The summoned creature is friendly to you and your companions. It rolls its own initiative and has its own turns, but obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any commands to it, it defends itself from hostile creatures, but otherwise takes no actions. The DM has the creature’s statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Dartak's Retribution

time.condition: which you take when you would take fire or lightning damage

entries: This spell draws in and encapsulates combustive energy, protecting you from and wreathing you in fire or lightning from a single source. You grant resistance to the triggering damage to yourself and any creatures you choose within 30 feet of you. You can also choose to immediately channel that fire or lightning away from you in a 5-foot wide, 90-foot long line. If you do, each creature within the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 6d6} of the respective damage type on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Detect Portal
entries: You detect the nearest portal within 1 mile of you and learn the following information about it:

items: Its location
Its destination (both the plane it leads to and the exact location on that plane)
If it requires certain circumstances or items to use, you learn what those circumstances or items are.
If it requires a password to use, you learn that it requires a password but do not learn the password.
Whether it is temporary, such as portals cast by the gate spell, or permanent This spell does not detect non-portal teleportation magic, such as teleportation circles.

spell.name: Dismantle
entries: This spell breaks or tears a nonmagical object worth up to 10gp. The break or tear can be up to 1 foot in any dimension. Make a melee spell attack roll to cast this spell on a construct. On a hit, this spell deals {@damage 2d6} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 3d6}), 11th level ({@dice 4d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d6}).

spell.name: Elminster’s Evoked Delivery

m.text: a small bit of sealing wax, which the spell consumes

entries: You instantaneously shunt an object through the fabric of space to a willing creature with which you are familiar. The object can be no larger than 1 foot on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds. When you cast the spell, the recipient is magically informed what the object is. If the creature is willing, the object appears in empty space within 5 feet of the creature (the creature’s choice). If the creature is on another plane of existence, is {@condition incapacitated}, is proofed against magical detection or location, or is unwilling to receive the object, the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum dimensions increase by both 1 foot on each side and 10 pounds for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Folk Rite

m.text: 25gp in herbs, incense and other materials, consumed by the spell

entries: You perform a ritual of folk magic designed to bring the blessings of gods or spirits on those who take part.

items: {@b Blessing of the Exorcism}. One individual you touch who is {@condition charmed} or possessed may immediately make a saving throw against that effect (as the original saving throw), ending the effect on a success. Once a creature receives this blessing, it cannot do so again for 7 days.

{@b Blessing of the Faithful}. You perform a worship service with a number of creatures up to your caster level, all of whom must be within 30 feet of you for the duration of the spell.
